-------------------------------------Unique Even Sum(Q54)----------------------

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication7
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            int n1 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            int[] a1=new int[n1];
            for (int i = 0; i < n1; i++)
			{
			 a1[i]=Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
			}
            int n2=UserProgramCode.addUniqueEven(a1);
            Console.WriteLine( n2);
            
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int addUniqueEven(int[] a1)
        {
            List<int> ll = new List<int>();
            int flag=0,sum=0;
            for (int i = 0; i < a1.Length; i++)
            {
                flag = 0;
                for (int j = 0; j < a1.Length; j++)
                {
                    if (i != j)
                    {

                        if (a1[i] == a1[j])
                            flag = 1;
                    }
                }
                if (flag == 0)
                    ll.Add(a1[i]);
            }
          
            for (int i = 0; i < ll.Count; i++)
            {
                if (ll[i] % 2 == 0)
                    sum = sum + ll[i];
            }
            if (sum == 0)
                return -1;
            else
            return sum;
        }
            
    }
}

---------------------------------------largest Span(Q55)------------------------------------------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication45
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            int n = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            int[] a = new int[n];
            for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
            {
                a[i] = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            }
            int span = UserProgramCode.getMaxSpan(n,a);
            Console.WriteLine(span);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int getMaxSpan(int n,int[] a)
        {
            int count=0,flag=0;
            for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
            {
                for (int j = n-1; j>=0; j--)
                {
                    if (!(i == j))
                    {
                        if (a[i] == a[j])
                        {
                            flag=1;
                            count = j - i + 1;
                            break;
                        }
                    }
                }
                if (count != 0)
                    break;
            }
            if (flag == 0)
                return 0;

            return count;
        }
    }

}
-----------------------------Reimbursement(Q56)----------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication51
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            double f=Convert.ToDouble(Console.ReadLine());
            int p = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            bool bs = Convert.ToBoolean(Console.ReadLine());
            int r = UserProgramCode.calulateAmountRefundable(f,p,bs);
            if(r==-1)
                Console.WriteLine("Low fees amount");
            else if(r==-2)
                Console.WriteLine("Invalid percentage");
            else
                Console.WriteLine(r);
                Console.ReadLine();


        }
    }
        class UserProgramCode
        {
            public static int calulateAmountRefundable(double f,int p,bool bs)
            {
                int flag=0,count=0;
               double a=0;
               if (f >= 25000)
                   flag = 1;
               if (p >= 80 && p <= 100)
                   count = 1;
               if (bs == false && count == 1)
               {
                   if (flag == 1)
                   {
                       if (p >= 80 && p <= 85)
                           a = 0.4 * f + 3000;
                       else if (p >= 86 && p <= 90)
                           a = 0.5 * f + 5000;
                       else if (p > 90)
                           a = 0.5 * f + 7000;
                   }
                   else
                       a = -1;
               }
               else
                   a = -2;

               return Convert.ToInt32(a);
            }
      }
}

-----------------------------Insurance Guide(Q57)---------------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication51
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            char c1 = Convert.ToChar(Console.ReadLine());
            int n = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            char c2 = Convert.ToChar(Console.ReadLine());
            char c3 = Convert.ToChar(Console.ReadLine());
            UserProgramCode.InsuranceGuide(c1, n, c2, c3);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
        {
        public static void InsuranceGuide(char c1, int n, char c2, char c3)
        {
            int i=0;
            double d=0;
            if (n > 60)
            Console.WriteLine("Age limit Exceeded");
            else if (c1 == 'E' && n >= 25 && n <= 35 && c3 == 'C')
            {
                if(c2=='M')
                {
                    i = 4;
                    d = 200000;
                    Console.WriteLine(i);
                    Console.WriteLine(d);
                }
                else
                {
                    i = 3;
                    d = 100000;
                    Console.WriteLine(i);
                    Console.WriteLine(d);
                }
            }
            else if (c1 == 'P' && n >= 25 && n <= 35 && c3 == 'V')
            {
                if (c2 == 'M')
                {
                    i = 6;
                    d = 10000;
                    Console.WriteLine(i);
                    Console.WriteLine(d);
                }
            }
            else
                Console.WriteLine("The person cannot be insured");
            
        }
        }
}

---------------------Display Students Exam Eligibility status(Q58)------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication51
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            int n1 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            int n2 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            string str=UserProgramCode.FindResult(n1,n2);
            Console.WriteLine(str);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static string FindResult(int n1, int n2)
        {
            string s="";
            if (n1 > 100 || n2 > 100)
                s = "Invalid Input";
            else
            {
                if (n1 >= 55 && n2 >= 45)
                    s = "P";
                else if (n1 < 55 && n2 >= 55)
                {
                    if (n1 >= 45)
                        s = "P";
                }
                else if (n1 >= 65 && n2 < 45)
                    s = "R";
                else
                    s = "F";
            }

            return s;

            
        }
    }
}

------------------------Calculate Charge(Q59)---------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication51
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            string s2 = Console.ReadLine();
            int i=UserProgramCode.calculateCharge(s1,s2);
            if(i==-1)
                Console.WriteLine("Invalid Date format");
            else if(i==-2)
                Console.WriteLine("CheckoutDateTime is less than CheckinDateTime");
            else if(i==-3)
                Console.WriteLine("Duration exceeds 24 hrs");
            else
            Console.WriteLine(i);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int calculateCharge(string s1,string s2)
        {
            int f=0,h=0,d=0;
            DateTime dt1,dt2;
            bool b1 = DateTime.TryParseExact(s1, "yyyy-MM-dd:HH:mm:ss", null, System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.None, out dt1);
            bool b2 = DateTime.TryParseExact(s2, "yyyy-MM-dd:HH:mm:ss", null, System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.None, out dt2);
            if (b1 && b2)
            {
                if (dt2 > dt1)
                {
                    d = (dt2 - dt1).Days;
                    h = (dt2 - dt1).Hours + d * 24;
                    if (h > 24)
                        f = -3;
                    else
                    {
                        if (h < 3)
                            f = 20;
                        else
                            f = 20 + (h - 3) * 5;
                    }
                }
                else
                    f = -2;
            }
            else f = -1;

            return f;
        }
    }
}

---------------------------------------Get word with Maximum Vowels(Q60)-----------------------------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication47
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string a = Console.ReadLine();
            string b = UserProgramCode.getWordWithMaximumVowels(a);
            Console.WriteLine(b);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static string getWordWithMaximumVowels(string a)
        {
            int count=0;
            int max = 0;
            int m=0;
            string[] ss=a.Split(' ');
            for (int i = 0; i < ss.Length; i++)
            {
                count = 0;
                char[] ch = ss[i].ToCharArray();
                for (int j = 0; j < ch.Length; j++)
                {
                    if (ch[j] == 'a' || ch[j] == 'e' || ch[j] == 'i' || ch[j] == 'o' || ch[j] == 'u' || ch[j] == 'A' || ch[j] == 'E' || ch[j] == 'I' || ch[j] == 'O' || ch[j] == 'U')
                        count++;
                }
               
                if(count>max)
                {
                    max = count;
                    m=i;
                }
            }
            return ss[m];

        }
    }
}

-----------------------------Check Palindrome(Q61)----------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication51
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            int i = UserProgramCode.checkPalindrome(s1);
            if(i==1)
                Console.WriteLine("Palindrome");
            else
                Console.WriteLine("Not Palindrome");
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int checkPalindrome(string s1)
        {
            s1=s1.ToLower();
            int flag=0,count=0;
            if (s1.Length % 2 == 0)
            {
                for (int i = 0; i < s1.Length / 2; i++)
                {
                    flag = 0;
                    if (s1[i] == s1[s1.Length - i - 1])
                        flag = 1;
                }
            }
            else
            {
                for (int i = 0; i < (s1.Length / 2)+1; i++)
                {
                    flag = 0;
                    if (s1[i] == s1[s1.Length - i - 1])
                        flag = 1;
                }
            }
           
            for (int i = 0; i < s1.Length; i++)
            {
                if(s1[i]=='a'||s1[i]=='e'||s1[i]=='i'||s1[i]=='o'||s1[i]=='u')
                    count++;
            }
            if (flag == 1 && count > 1)
                return 1;
            else
                return -1;
        }
    }
}
-------------------------------OR-------------------------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication51
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            int i = UserProgramCode.checkPalindrome(s1);
            if(i==1)
                Console.WriteLine("Palindrome");
            else
                Console.WriteLine("Not Palindrome");
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int checkPalindrome(string s1)
        {
            int count = 0;
            char[] ch = s1.ToLower().ToCharArray();
            char[] ch1 = s1.ToLower().ToCharArray();
            ch=ch.Distinct().ToArray();
            for (int i = 0; i < ch.Length; i++)
            {
                if(ch[i]=='a'||ch[i]=='e'||ch[i]=='i'||ch[i]=='o'||ch[i]=='u')
                    count++;
            }
            Array.Reverse(ch);
            string s2 = new string(ch1);
            s1 = s1.ToLower();
            s2 = s2.ToLower();
            if (s1 == s2 && count > 1)
                return 1;
            else
                return -1;
        }
    }
}

------------------------Reverse the adjacent pairs of letters(Q62)-------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication51
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            string s2 = UserProgramCode.swapPairs(s1);
            Console.WriteLine(s2);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static string swapPairs(string s1)
        {
            int flag = 0;
            string sr = "";
            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
            char[] ch = s1.ToCharArray();
            for (int j = 0; j < ch.Length; j++)
            {
                if (!(char.IsLetter(ch[j])))
                flag = 1;
            }
            if (flag == 1)
                sr = "Invalid Input";
            else
            {
                for (int i = 0; i < ch.Length - 1; i = i + 2)
                {
                    sb.Append(ch[i + 1]);
                    sb.Append(ch[i]);
                }
                if (ch.Length % 2 != 0)
                    sb.Append(ch[ch.Length - 1]);
                    
              sr = sb.ToString();
            }
            return sr;
        }
    }
}

--------------------------Convert Roman To Decimal(Q63)----------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication1
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s = Console.ReadLine();
            int n = UserProgramCode.convertRomanToDecimal(s);
            Console.WriteLine(n);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int convertRomanToDecimal(string s)
        {
            int k = 0,sum=0,flag=0;
            char[] ch = s.ToLower().ToCharArray();
            int[] o = new int[20];
            for (int i = 0; i < ch.Length; i++)
            {
                if (ch[i] == 'i')
                {
                    o[k] = 1;
                    k++;
                }
                else if (ch[i] == 'v')
                {
                    o[k] = 5;
                    k++;
                }
                else if (ch[i] == 'x')
                {
                    o[k] = 10;
                    k++;
                }
                else if (ch[i] == 'l')
                {
                    o[k] = 50;
                    k++;
                }
                else if (ch[i] == 'c')
                {
                    o[k] = 100;
                    k++;
                }
                else if (ch[i] == 'd')
                {
                    o[k] = 500;
                    k++;
                }
                else if (ch[i] == 'm')
                {
                    o[k] = 1000;
                    k++;
                }
                else
                    flag = 1;

            }

            if (flag == 1)
                sum = -1;
            else
            {
                for (int j = 0; j < k; j++)
                {
                    sum = sum + o[j];
                }
            }

            return sum;

        }
    }
}

----------------------------Duplicate Characters(Q64)------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication57
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            string s2 = UserProgramCode.removeDuplicates(s1);
            Console.WriteLine(s2);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static string removeDuplicates(string s1)
        {
            char[] ch = s1.ToCharArray();
            List<char> l = new List<char>();


            for (int i = 0; i < ch.Length; i++)
            {
                if (!(l.Contains(ch[i])))
                    l.Add(ch[i]);
            }
            string s2 = new string(l.ToArray());
            return s2;
        }
    }
}

--------------------------All Vowels(65)-----------------------------

same as Q(67)Test Vowels Order


--------------------------String Occurences(Q66)------------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication55
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            string s2 = Console.ReadLine();
            int n = UserProgramCode.countNoOfWords(s1,s2);
            Console.WriteLine(n);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int countNoOfWords(string s1,string s2)
        {
            int count = 0;
            string[] ss = s1.Split(' ');
            string[] ss1 = s2.Split(' ');
            for (int i = 0; i < ss.Length; i++)
            {
                if (ss[i] == ss1[1]) 
                count++;
            }
            return count;
        }
    }
}
---------------------------------Test Vowels Order(Q67)--------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Text.RegularExpressions;

namespace ValidateIDLocations
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            int n = UserProgramCode.testOrderVowels(s1);
            Console.WriteLine(n);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int testOrderVowels(string s1)
        {
            int count = 0;
            char c=' ';
            char[] ch = s1.ToCharArray();
            for (int i = 0; i < ch.Length; i++)
            {
                if (ch[i] == 'a' || ch[i] == 'e' || ch[i] == 'i' || ch[i] == 'o' || ch[i] == 'u')
                {
                    if (ch[i] >= c)
                    {
                        count++;
                        c = ch[i];
                    }

                }
            }
            if (count == 5)
                return 1;
            else if (count > 5)
                return -1;
            else
                return 2; 
        }
    }
}
---------------------------------------Remove Duplicates(Q68)------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication57
{     
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            string s2 = UserProgramCode.removeDuplicates(s1);
            Console.WriteLine(s2);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static string removeDuplicates(string s1)
        {
            char[] ch = s1.ToCharArray();
            List<char> l=new List<char>();

           
            for (int i = 0; i < ch.Length; i++)
            {
                if(!(l.Contains(ch[i]))&& ch[i]!=' ')
                    l.Add(ch[i]);
                if (ch[i] == ' ' && l[(l.Count)-1] != ' ')
                    l.Add(ch[i]);

            }
            string s2 = new string(l.ToArray());
            return s2;
        }
    }
}

-------------------------------Maximum Vowels(Q69)-----------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication57
{     
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            string s2 = UserProgramCode.getWordWithMaximumVowels(s1);
            Console.WriteLine(s2);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static string getWordWithMaximumVowels(string s1)
        {
            int count = 0, max = 0, v = 0;

            string[] ss = s1.Split(' ');
            for (int i = 0; i < ss.Length; i++)
            {
                char[] ch=ss[i].ToLower().ToCharArray();
                for (int j = 0; j < ch.Length; j++)
                {
                    count = 0;
                    if (ch[j] == 'a' || ch[j] == 'e' || ch[j] == 'i' || ch[j] == 'o' || ch[j] == 'u')
                    {
                        count++;
                    }
                    if (count > max)
                    {
                        max = count;
                        v = i;
                    }
                }
            }

            return ss[v];
        }
    }
}


--------------------------------------------Find Span(Q70)--------------------


( Same as question no. (55) Largest Span. )

--------------------------------------------Check Anagrams(Q71)---------------------

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication26
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            string s2 = Console.ReadLine();
            bool b = UserProgramCode.checkAnagram(s1,s2);
            if(b==true)
                Console.WriteLine("TRUE");
            else
                Console.WriteLine("FALSE");
            Console.ReadLine();

        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static bool checkAnagram(string s1, string s2)
        {
            int flag = 0,count=0;
            char[] ch1 = s1.ToLower().ToCharArray();
            char[] ch2 = s2.ToLower().ToCharArray();
            
            Array.Sort(ch1);
            Array.Sort(ch2);
            Array.Reverse(ch1);
            Array.Reverse(ch2);
            if (ch1.Length < ch2.Length)
            {
                for (int i = 0; i < ch1.Length; i++)
                {
                    if (ch1[i] == ch2[i])
                        flag++;
                }
                if (flag == ch1.Length)
                    count=1;
            }
            else 
            {
                for (int i = 0; i < ch2.Length; i++)
                {
                    if (ch1[i] == ch2[i])
                        flag++;
                }
                if (flag == ch2.Length)
                    count=1;
            }
            
            if(count==1)
                return true;
            else
                return false;

        }
    }
}

---------------------------------------------Check Batch Code(Q72)---------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication26
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s1 = Console.ReadLine();
            string s2 = UserProgramCode.checkBatch(s1);
            Console.WriteLine(s2);
            Console.ReadLine();

        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static string checkBatch(string s1)
        {
            string s0=s1.Substring(5,2);
            string s2=s1.Substring(0, 3);
            string s3=s1.Substring(7,3);
            char[] ch1=s3.ToCharArray();
            string s4=s1.Substring(3,2);
            char[] ch2=s4.ToCharArray();
            string s5="";
            if (s2 == "CHN")
                s5 = "Chennai";
            else if (s2 == "CBE")
                s5 = "Coimbatore";
            else if (s2 == "KOC")
                s5 = "Kochi";
            else if (s2 == "PUN")
                s5 = "Pune";
            else if (s2 == "BGL")
                s5 = "Bangalore";
            else if (s2 == "HYD")
                s5 = "Hyderabad";
            else if (s2 == "KOL")
                s5 = "Kolkata";
            else
                return "-1";

            for (int i = 0; i < ch1.Length; i++)
            {
                if(!(char.IsDigit(ch1[i])))
                    return "-2";
            }
            for (int i = 0; i < ch2.Length; i++)
            {
                if (!(char.IsDigit(ch2[i])))
                    return "-2";
            }
            if (s0 != "DN")
                return "-3";

            return "DotNet batch "+s3+" has joined in 20"+s4+" year and is at "+s5+" Location";
        
        }
    }
}

---------------------------------------------------Concatenate Characters(Q73)-------------------

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication26
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            int n = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            string[] a1 = new string[n];
            for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
            {
                a1[i] = Console.ReadLine();
            }
            string s2 = UserProgramCode.concatCharacter(a1);
            Console.WriteLine(s2);
            Console.ReadLine();

        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static string concatCharacter(string[] a1)
        {
            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
            if(a1.Length==1)
                return "-3";
            for (int i = 0; i < a1.Length; i++)
            {
                char[] ch=a1[i].ToCharArray();
                for (int j = 0; j < ch.Length; j++)
			    {
			           if(char.IsDigit(ch[i]))
                           return "-1";
                       else if(!(char.IsLetterOrDigit(ch[i])))
                           return "-2";
			    }
                
                sb.Append(ch[1]);
            }
            return sb.ToString();
        }
    }
}


---------------------------------------------Image Types(Q74)--------------------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication26
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            int n = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            string[] ss = new string[n];
            for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
            {
                ss[i] = Console.ReadLine();
            }
            List<string> ll = new List<string>();
            ll = UserProgramCode.countImageTypes(ss);
            for (int i = 0; i < ll.Count; i++)
            {
                Console.WriteLine(ll[i]);
            }
            Console.ReadLine();

        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static List<string> countImageTypes(string[] ss)
        {
            List<string> ls = new List<string>();
            int c1 = 0, c2 = 0, c3 = 0, c4 = 0, c5 = 0, c6 = 0, c7 = 0, c8 = 0,c9=0;
            
            string [] op = new string[100];
            for (int i = 0; i < ss.Length; i++)
            {
                if (!(ss[i].Contains('.')))
                    c9++;
                else
                {
                    string[] s1 = ss[i].Split('.');
                    if (s1[1] == "jpeg")
                        c1++;
                    else if (s1[1] == "jfif")
                        c2++;
                    else if (s1[1] == "exif")
                        c3++;
                    else if (s1[1] == "tiff")
                        c4++;
                    else if (s1[1] == "raw")
                        c5++;
                    else if (s1[1] == "gif")
                        c6++;
                    else if (s1[1] == "bmp")
                        c7++;
                    else if (s1[1] == "png")
                        c8++;
                    else if (s1[1] == "") ;
                    else
                        c9++;
                }
            }
            if (c1 != 0)
            {
                ls.Add("jpeg");
                ls.Add(c1.ToString());
            }
            if (c2 != 0)
            {
                ls.Add("jfif");
                ls.Add(c2.ToString());
            }
            if (c3 != 0)
            {
                ls.Add("exif");
                ls.Add(c3.ToString());
            }
            if (c4 != 0)
            {
                ls.Add("tiff");
                ls.Add(c4.ToString());
            }
            if (c5 != 0)
            {
                ls.Add("raw");
                ls.Add(c5.ToString());
            }
            if (c6 != 0)
            {
                ls.Add("gif");
                ls.Add(c6.ToString());
            }
            if (c7 != 0)
            {
                ls.Add("bmp");
                ls.Add(c7.ToString());
            }
            if (c8 != 0)
            {
                ls.Add("png");
                ls.Add(c8.ToString());
            }
            if (c9 != 0)
            {
                ls.Add("others");
                ls.Add(c9.ToString());
            }

            return ls;

        }
    }
}

--------------------------------------Calculate Salary(Q75)--------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication26
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            int e = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            string tes = Console.ReadLine();
            int p = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            int s = UserProgramCode.calculateNewSalary(e,tes,p);
            if(s==0)
                Console.WriteLine("Invalid Salary");
            else if(s==-1)
                Console.WriteLine("Invalid Experience");
            else if(s==-2)
                Console.WriteLine("Invalid Technology expertise classification");
            else
            Console.WriteLine("Your Salary is fixed as Rs {0}", s);
            Console.ReadLine();

        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int calculateNewSalary(int e,string tes,int p)
        {
            double s1 = 0, s0 = 0, s2 = 0;
            if (p > 100000 || p < 0)
                return 0;
            s0=p*0.3;
            if (e > 3 && e <= 5)
                s1 = p * 0.05;
            else if (e > 5 && e <= 8)
                s1 = p * 0.1;
	    else if (e > 8 && e<=25)
                s1 = p * 0.15;
            else if (e > 25 || e < 0)
                return -1;
            if (tes == "RS")
                s2 = p * 0.05;
            else if (tes == "CS")
                s2 = 0;
            else
                return -2;

            int ts = (int)(p+s1 + s2 + s0);
            return ts;

        }
    }
}
-----------------------------------Calculate Discount(Q76)----------------
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication26
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            int n1 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            int[] a1=new int[n1];
            for (int i = 0; i < n1; i++)
			{
			 a1[i]=Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
			}
            int n2 = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            int[] a2 = new int[n2];
            for (int j = 0; j < n2; j++)
            {
                a2[j] = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            }
            int[] d = new int[n1];
            d = UserProgramCode.calcDiscount(a1, a2);
            for (int k = 0; k < n1; k++)
            {
                Console.WriteLine(d[k]);
            }


            Console.ReadLine();

        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int[] calcDiscount(int[] a1, int[] a2)
        {
            int k = 0, l = 0,m=0,da=0,v=0,flag=0,count=0;
            List<int> ll = new List<int>();
            int[] bm = new int[a1.Length/2];
            int[] ba = new int[a2.Length/2];
            int[] uid = new int[a1.Length / 2];
            int[] out1 = new int[a1.Length];
            for (int i = 0; i < a1.Length; i++)
            {
                if (i % 2 == 0)
                {
                    uid[m] = a1[i];
                    m++;
                }
                else
                {
                    bm[k] = a1[i];
                    k++;
                }
            }
            for (int j = 1; j < a2.Length; j=j+2)
            {
                ba[l] = a2[j];
                l++;
            }

            for (int x = 0; x < k; x++)
            {
                if (ba[x] >= 500000)
                {
                    if (bm[x] >= 1 && bm[x] < 5)
                        da = (int)(ba[x] * 0.25);
                    else if (bm[x] >= 5 && bm[x] < 9)
                        da = (int)(ba[x] * 0.2);
                    else if (bm[x] >= 9 && bm[x] < 13)
                        da = (int)(ba[x] * 0.15);
                    else
                        flag = 1;
                }
                else if (ba[x] >= 100000 && ba[x] < 500000)
                {

                    if (bm[x] >= 1 && bm[x] < 5)
                        da = (int)(ba[x] * 0.15);
                    else if (bm[x] >= 5 && bm[x] < 9)
                        da = (int)(ba[x] * 0.1);
                    else if (bm[x] >= 9 && bm[x] < 13)
                        da = (int)(ba[x] * 0.05);
                    else
                        flag = 1;
                }
                else if (ba[x] < 100000)
                    da = 0;
                else if (ba[x] < 0)
                    count = 1;

                ll.Add(uid[v]);
                v++;
                ll.Add(da);
            }
            if (flag == 1)
                out1[0] = -1;
            else if (count == 1)
                out1[0] = -2;
            else
                out1=ll.ToArray();
            return out1;
        }
    }
}
----------------------------------EMI calculation(Q77)--------------------
(In this program the formula for calculating the EMI is EMI = [P x R x (1+R)^N]/[(1+R)^N-1],so the output is according to this formula.)


using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication26
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            string s = Console.ReadLine();
            int n = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            int n1 = UserProgramCode.checkEmpAgeEligible(s, n);
            Console.WriteLine(n1);
            Console.ReadLine();

        }
    }
    class UserProgramCode
    {
        public static int checkEmpAgeEligible(string s, int n)
        {
            DateTime dt;
            var today=DateTime.Today;
            double emi1=0,emi2=0,emi=0;
            bool b = DateTime.TryParseExact(s, "dd-MM-yyyy", null, System.Globalization.DateTimeStyles.None, out dt);
            int age = today.Year-dt.Year;
           // Console.WriteLine(age);
            
            if (!b)
                return -1;
            if (!(n == 12 || n == 24 || n == 36 || n == 48))
                return -2;
            else
            {
                if (age <= 22)
                {
                    emi1 = 200000 * 3 * Math.Pow(4, n);
                    emi2 = Math.Pow(4, n) - 1;
                    emi = emi1 / emi2;
                }
                else if (age > 22 && age <= 45)
                {
                    emi1 = 200000 * 5 * Math.Pow(6, n);
                    emi2 = Math.Pow(6, n) - 1;
                    emi = emi1 / emi2;
                }
                else if (age > 45 && age <= 100)
                {
                    emi1 = 200000 * 7 * Math.Pow(8, n);
                    emi2 = Math.Pow(8, n) - 1;
                    emi = emi1 / emi2;
                }
            }


            return (int)emi;
        }
    }
}

--------------------------------------Roman Numeral(Q78)------------------

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace ConsoleApplication55
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            int n = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
            string s1 = "";
            int[] num = { 1, 4, 5, 9, 10, 40, 50, 90, 100, 400, 500, 900, 1000 };
            string[] s = { "I", "IV", "V", "IX", "X", "XL", "L", "XC", "C", "CD", "D", "CM", "M" };
            if (n < 0)
            {
              s1 = "Invalid Input";
            }
            else if (n > 4000)
            {
              s1 = "Greater than 4000";
            }
           else
            {
              while (n > 0)
               {
                 for (int i = num.Length- 1; i >= 0; i--)
                  {
                   if (n / num[i] >= 1)
                     {
                        n = n - num[i];
                        sb.Append(s[i]);
                        break;
                     }
                  }
               }
           }
           s1 = sb.ToString();
           Console.WriteLine(s1);
           Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
}

-------------------------------------Permutations(Q79)-----------------------

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
 
namespace ConsoleApplication1
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            Permutation("abc");
            Console.Read();
        }
      
        public static void Permutation(string input)
        {
            RecPermutation("", input);
        }
        private static void RecPermutation(string soFar, string input)
        {
            if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(input))
            {
                Console.WriteLine(soFar);
                return;
            }
            else
            {
                for (int i = 0; i < input.Length; i++)
                {
 
                    string remaining = input.Substring(0, i) + input.Substring(i + 1);
                    RecPermutation(soFar + input[i], remaining);
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

17)A HashTable t maintains a collection of names of states and capital city of each state. Which of the following is the correct way to find out whether "Kerala" state is present in this collection or not?
	
t.HasValue("Kerala"); 
	
t.HasKey("Kerala");

18)Which of the following statements are correct about the C#.NET code snippet given below?

Stack st = new Stack();
st.Push("hello");
st.Push(8.2);
st.Push(5);
st.Push('b');
st.Push(true);
	
This is a perfectly workable code.-------------------------ANS  
	
In the fourth call to Push(), we should write "b" in place of 'b' 
	
Boolean values can never be stored in Stack collection. 
	
Dissimilar elements like "hello", 8.2, 5 cannot be stored in the same Stack collection. 

=================================================================================================================================

Console.WriteLine(e.Current);

while (e.MoveNext())
Console.WriteLine(e.Current); 
	
IEnumerator e;
e = Stack.GetEnumerator(); 
while (e.MoveNext()) 
Console.WriteLine(e.Current);

22)What will be the output of given code snippet?

public class Generic<T>
{
 Stack<T> stk = new Stack<T>();
 public void push(T obj)
 {
 stk.Push(obj);
 }
 public T pop()
 {
 T obj = stk.Pop();
 return obj;
 }
}
class Program
{
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 Generic<string> g = new Generic<string>();
 g.push("40");
 Console.WriteLine(g.pop());
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
} 
	
Runtime Error 
	
Compile time Error 
	
40 -------------ANS 
	
0 

=================================================================================================================================

25)Are generics in C# are same as the generics in java and templates in C++?
	
No-------------ANS  
	
Yes 
	
None of the mentioned 
	
May be 

=============
Delegates
=============
Q0.
Please read the questions carefully and choose the most appropriate option.Which of the given options is FALSE about delegate?
	
The signature of a delegate must match the signature of the method that is to be called using it. 
	
A single delegate can invoke more than one method. 
	
Delegate is a value type. 
	
Delegates can be shared. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Q1     Please read the questions carefully and choose the most appropriate option.Which of the given options are TRUE about a delegate? 
1.Delegates permit execution of a method on a secondary thread in an asynchronous manner.
2.Delegates are not type-safe.
	
only 2 	
only 1	---------------ANS
Both 1 and 2 	
None of the listed options

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Q2      Please read the questions carefully and choose the most appropriate option.Which of the given options is FALSE about delegate? 
1.Only one method can be called using a delegate.
2.Delegates are object oriented.
	
Both 1 and 2 
only 2 	
None of the listed options 
only 1---------------ANS
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Q3     To implement delegates the necessary condition for implementation is?
inheritance 
run time polymorphism 
class decleration    ---------------ANS
exceptions
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

Q4   Which is the incorrect statement about delegate? 
delegates are type safe wrappers for funtion pointers ---------------ANS
delegate is a value type 
delegates could be shared 
A single delegate can invoke more than one method 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Q5     Which is the correct way to call the function abc() of the given class csharp given below?

class csharp
{
    public int abc(int a)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("A:Just do it!");
        return 0;
    }
}
	
a) none of the mentioned 

b) delegate int del(int a);	 ---------------ANS
   del d;
    csharp s = new csharp();		
   d = new del(ref s.fun);
   d(10); 		
	
c) csharp s = new csharp();
    delegate void d = new del(ref abc);
   d(10); 
	
d)  delegate void del(int a);
    csharp s = new csharp();
  del d = new del(ref s.abc);
  d(10); 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Q6	Select the modifiers which controls the accessibility of the delegate 
All the given options 	---------------ANS	
new 
internal 
protected 
public 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Q7 Incorrect statement about delegates are?	
a)	Delegates are reference types 
b)	Only one method can be called using a delegate ---------------ANS	
c)	Delegates are object oriented 
d)	Delegates are type safe 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Q8 Please read the questions carefully and choose the most appropriate option.Which of the given options are TRUE about a delegate?

a)	Delegates provide wrappers for function pointers. 
b)	The declaration of a delegate must match the signature of the method that we intend to call using it. 
c)	Delegates are type-safe. 
d)	All the listed options 	---------------ANS

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

a)	Both 1 and 2 
b)	None of the listed options 
c)	only 2 
d)	only 1 ---------------ANS

1. If signatures of two methods are same they can be called through the same delegate object.
2. Delegates cannot be used to call an instance function. Delegates cannot be used to call an instance subroutine.

b) Both 1 and 2

Correct statement about delegate declaration given below is ?
delegate void del(int i);

b)	the del class will contain a one arguement constructor and an invoke() method 
c)	All of the mentioned ---------------ANS
d)	the del class is derived from the MulticastDelegate class

c)	Delegates created in C#.NET are further not allowed to derive from the delegate types that are created 
d)	All of the mentioned ---------------ANS

Q18 What will be the output of the given code snippet below?

 delegate void A(ref string str);
 class sample
 {
 public static void fun( ref string a)
 {
 a = a.Substring( 7, a.Length - 7);
 }
 }
 class Program
 {
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 A str1;
 string str = "Test Your C#.net skills";
 str1 = sample.fun;
 str1(ref str);
 Console.WriteLine(str);
 }
 }


 
a) Test Your 
 
b) ur C#.net skills ---------------ANS
 
c) None of the mentioned 
 
d) ur C#.NET 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

d) delegate are of reference types

q21 What will be the output of given set of code?

delegate string f(string str);
    class sample
    {
        public static string fun(string a)
        {
            return a.Replace('k', 'o');
        }
    }
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            f str1 = new f(sample.fun);
            string str = str1("Test Ykur C#.NET Skills");
            Console.WriteLine(str);
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
 
Test Your C#.NET Soills---------------ANS
 
Test Ykour C#.NET Skills 
 
Test Ykur C#.NET Skills 
 
Test ur C#.NET Skills

LINQ:

1) What will be the output of given code snippet?

 class Program
 {
     static void Main(string[] args)
     {
         int[] nums = { 1, -2, 3, 0, -4, 5};
         var posNums = from n in nums
                       where n >= 0
                       select n;
        foreach (int i in posNums) 
        Console.Write(i + " ");
        Console.WriteLine();
        Console.ReadLine();
    }		
}


a)1, 3, 5 
b)Run time error 
c)1, 3, 0, 5 ----------------------ANS
d)0, 1, -2, -4, 5 
================================================================================================================
2.Choose the namespace in which Expression trees are encapsulated:

System.Linq 
System.Collections.Generic 
System.Linq.Expressions  ----------------------ANS
System.Text 
================================================================================================================


3.) 
 
Select the output for given code snippet:

class Program
{
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 int[] nums = {1};
 var posNums = from n in nums
 where n > 0 
 select Math.Max(78, 9);
 Console.Write(“The largest values in nums: “);
 foreach (int I in posNums) Console.Write(I + “ “);
 Console.WriteLine();		
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
} 
 
code run successfully print nothing 
 
Run time error 
 
Compile time error 
 
code run successfully print required output ----------------------ANS



================================================================================================================

Q4


For the given set of code what is output?

class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
 
            int[] nums = { 1, -2, -3, 5 };
            var posNums = from n in nums
                          orderby n descending
                          select n*4 / 2;
            Console.Write("The values in nums: ");
            foreach (int i in posNums) Console.Write(i + " ");
            Console.WriteLine();
            Console.ReadLine();
        }		
    }
 
5 1 -2 -3 
 
10 2 -4 -6 ----------------------ANS
 
Run time error 
 
1 5 -2 -3

8.)
For the given set of code what is output representing?

class Program
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        int[] nums = { 1, -2, 3, 0, -4, 5 };
        var posNums = from n in nums
                      where n > 0
                      select n;
        int len = posNums.Count();
        Console.WriteLine(len);
        Console.ReadLine();
    }
}
 
Execution of code with nothing being printed 
 
Execution of code with printing all numbers 
 
Execution of code with counting total numbers greater than zero ----------------------ANS 
 
Run time error

9.)
Assume 2 columns named as Product and Category how can be both sorted out based on first by category and then by product name?
 
var sortedProds = _db.Products.Orderby(c => c.Category) . ThenBy(n => n.Name)  ----------------------ANS
 
var sortedProds = _db.Products.Orderby(c => c.Category) 
 
var sortedProds = _db.Products.Orderby(c => c.Category) + ThenBy(n => n.Name) 
 
All of the mentioned 
================================================================================================================


10.)
Select the output for given code snippet:

class Program
{
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 int[] nums = { 1, -2, 3, 0, -4, 5 };
 var posNums = from n in nums
 where n > -5 && n < 6
 orderby n descending
 select n;
 Console.Write("Descending order in nums: ");
 foreach (int i in posNums) Console.Write(i + " ");
 Console.WriteLine();
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
} 
 
Compile time error 
 
Print nothing code run successfully 
 
Run time error 
 
Arranged in descending order code run successfully  ----------------------ANS

15.) For the given set of code what is output?

 class Program
 {
     static void Main(string[] args)
     {
         int[] nums = { 1, -2, 3, 0, -4, 5 };
         var posNums = nums.Where(n => n < 10).Select(r => r%3);
         Console.Write("The values in nums: ");
         foreach (int i in posNums) Console.Write(i + " ");
         Console.WriteLine();
         Console.ReadLine();
     }
 }
 
2 -1 0 0 -2 1 
 
1 -2 0 0 -1 2  ----------------------ANS
 
Compile time error 
 
Run time error

{
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 int[] nums = {1};
 var posNums = from n in nums
 where n > 0 
 select Math.Max(78, 9);
 Console.Write("The largest values in nums: ");
 foreach (int i in posNums) Console.Write(i + " ");
 Console.WriteLine();
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
} 
 
code run successfully print nothing 
 
code run successfully print required  ----------------------ANS

Compile time error 
 
Run time error

csharp abc;

c)	create an object of type csharp on stack 

d)	Create an object of type csharp on heap or on stack depending on size of object

5)Select the output for following set of code :

 class z
 {
 public string name1;
 public string address;
 public void show()
 {
 Console.WriteLine("{0} is in {1}", name1, address);
 }
 }
 class Program
 {
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 z n = new z();
 n.name1 = "harsh";
 n.address = "new delhi";
 n.show();
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
 } 
a)	Run successfully prints nothing 

b)	Syntax error 

c)	harsh is in new delhi --------------------ans

d)	{0} is in city{1} harsh new delhi 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

6)Select the output for following set of code :

  class sample
  {
      public int i;
      public int j;
      public void fun(int i, int j)
      {
          this.i = i;
          this.j = j;
      }
  }
  class Program
  {
      static void Main(string[] args)
      {
          sample s = new sample();
          s.i = 1;
          s.j = 2;
          s.fun(s.i, s.j);
          Console.WriteLine(s.i + " " + s.j);
          Console.ReadLine();
      }
  }
	
a)	Error while calling s.fun() due to inaccessible level 

b)	Run successfully but prints nothing 

c)	Error as ‘this’ reference would not be able to call ‘i’ and ‘j’ 

d)	1 2 ---------------------------------------ans

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

12) Select the output for following set of code :

 class z
 {
 public int X;
 public int Y;
 public const int c1 = 5;
 public const int c2 = c1 * 25;
 public void set(int a, int b)
 {
 X = a;
 Y = b;
 }
 
 }
 class Program
 {
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 z s = new z();
 s.set(10, 20);
 Console.WriteLine(s.X + " " + s.Y);
 Console.WriteLine(z.c1 + " " + z.c2);
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
 } 
a)20 10 
b)10 20-----------------------------ans
5 125 
c)20 10 
d)10 20

16)Select output for following set of code.

 class sample
 {
     public int i;
     public int[] arr = new int[10];
     public void fun(int i, int val)
     {
         arr[i] = val;
     }
 }
 class Program
 {
     static void Main(string[] args)
     {
         sample s = new sample();
         s.i = 10;
         sample.fun(1, 5);
         s.fun(1, 5);
         Console.ReadLine();
     }
 }
	
a)	sample.fun(1, 5) will not work correctly 

b)	sample.fun(1, 5) will set value as 5 in arr[1] 

c)	s.i = 10 cannot work as i is ‘public’ 

d)	s.fun(1, 5) will work correctly -----------------ans
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
17)The output of code is ?

 class test
 {
 public void print()
 {
 Console.WriteLine("Csharp:");
 }
 }
 class Program
 {
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 test t;
 t.print();
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
 } 
a)	Syntax error as t is unassigned variable which is never used -------------------------ans

b)	Code run successfully print nothing 

c)	None of the mentioned 

d)	Code run and print “Csharp” 

=======================
Properties
=======================

Q1

 
Choose the correct statement about properties describing the indexers? 
 
All of the mentioned -------------------ANS
 
An indexer property should accept at least one argument 
 
Indexers can be overloaded 
 
No need to use the name of the property while using an indexed property 


---------------------------------------------------------------------
Q2


Correct way to implement a write only property add in a math class?

 
None 
 
class math
  {
      int ad;
      public int add
      {
          get
          {
              return ad;
          }
          set
          {
              ad = value;
          }
      }
  } 
 
class math
   {
       public int add
       {
           set
           {
                add = value;
            }
        }
    } 
 
class math
   {
       int ad;
       public int add
       {
           set
           {
               ad = value;
           }
       }
   } -------------------ANS



---------------------------------------------------------------------
Q3

 
Select the modifiers which can be used with the properties? 
 
Protected Internal 
 
Protected 
 
Private 
 
Public 
 
All the given options -----------------------ANS  


---------------------------------------------------------------------

Q4

 
Choose the correct statements about write-only properties in C#.NET? 
 
Useful for usage in classes which store sensitive information like password of a user 
 
Properties which can only be set 
 
All of the listed options -------------------ANS
 
Properties once set and hence values cannot be read back in nature 


---------------------------------------------------------------------

Q5

 
Consider a class maths and we had a property called as sum.b is a reference to a maths object and we want the statement Console.WriteLine(b.sum)to fail.Which is the correct solution to ensure this functionality? 
 
Declare sum property with only set accessor -------------------ANS
 
Declare sum property with get, set and normal accessors 
 
Declare sum property with both get and set accessors 
 
Declare sum property with only get accessor 


---------------------------------------------------------------------

Q6


Correct way to implement a read only property add in a math class?

 
None 
 
class math
   {
       int ad;
       public int add
       {
           get
           {
               return ad;
           }
       }-------------------ANS
 
   } 
 
class math
   {
       int ad;
       public int add
       {
           get
           {
               return ad;
           }
           set
           {
               ad = value; 
           }
       }
   } 
 
class math
   {
      public int add
      {
          get
          {
              return ad;    
          }
      }
  } 


---------------------------------------------------------------------

Q7


Consider a class maths and we had a property called as sum.b is a reference to a maths object and we want the code below to work.Which is the correct solution to ensure this functionality?
b.maths = 10;
Console.WriteLine(b.maths);

 
Declare maths property with get and set accessors -------------------ANS
 
Declare maths property with only get, set and normal accessors 
 
Declare maths property with only get accessors 
 
Declare maths property with only set accessors 



---------------------------------------------------------------------
Q8

 
If math class had add property with get accessors then which statements will work correctly? 
 
math m = new math();
m.add = m.add + 20; 
 
math m = new math();
m.add = 10; 
 
math m = new math();
int i;
i = m.add; -------------------ANS
 
math.add = 20;

Q1

 
What will be the output of given set of code?

 class maths
 {
 public int length;
 public int breadth;
 public maths(int x, int y)
 {
 length = x;
 breadth = y;
 Console.WriteLine(x + y);
 }
 public maths(double x, int y)
 {
 length = (int)x;
 breadth = y;
 Console.WriteLine(x * y);
 }
 }
class Program
{
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 maths m = new maths(20, 40);
 maths k = new maths(12.0, 12);
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
} 
 
60
144.0 
 
60
24 
 
60
144      --------------ANS
 
60
0

 class maths
 {
 public int length;
 public int breadth;
 public maths(int x)
 {
 length = x + 1;
 }
 public maths(int x, int y)
 {
 length = x + 2;
 }
 }
 class Program
 {
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 maths m = new maths(6);
 maths k = new maths(6, 2);
 Console.WriteLine(m.length);
 Console.WriteLine(k.length);
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
 }

10

 {
     public maths()
     {
         Console.WriteLine("constructor 1 :");
     }

     {
         int p = 2;
         int u;
         u = p + x;
         Console.WriteLine("constructor 2: " +u);
     }
 }
 class Program
 {
     static void Main(string[] args)
     {
         maths k = new maths(4);
         maths t = new maths();
         Console.ReadLine();
     }
 }

constructor 1: --------------ANS
 
constructor 2: 6
constructor 2: 6 
 
constructor 1:
constructor 2: 6

Q7

 
What will be the output of given set of code?

 class maths
 {
 int i;
 public maths(int ii)
 {
 ii = 12;
 int j = 12;
 int r = ii * j;
 Console.WriteLine(r);
 }
 }
 class maths1 : maths
 {
 public maths1(int u) :base(u)
 {
 u = 13;
 int h = 13;
 Console.WriteLine(u + h);
 }
 }
 class maths2 : maths1
 {
 public maths2(int k) :base(k)
 {
 k = 24;
 int o = 6 ;
 Console.WriteLine(k /o);
 }
 }
 class Program
 {
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 maths2 t = new maths2(10);
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
 } 
 
144
26
4 --------------ANS
 
4
26
144 
 
0
0
0 
 
26
4
144

Q9


What will be the output of given set of code?

class maths
{
    int i;
    public  maths(int ii)
    {
        ii = -25;
        int g;
        g = ii > 0 ? ii : ii * -1;
        Console.WriteLine(g);
    }
}
class maths1 :maths
{
    public  maths1(int ll) :base(ll)
    {
        ll = -1000;
        Console.WriteLine((ll > 0 ? ll : ll * -1));
    }
}
class Program
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        maths1 p = new maths1(6);
        Console.ReadLine();
    }
}

 
-1025 
 
25
1000 --------------ANS
 
-1025 
 
None of mentioned

}

{

 {
 Console.WriteLine("bye");
 }
}

 {

 Console.ReadLine();
 }
}

bye

hello: 
bye --------------ANS

xml
======================

If the XML data instance conforms to the DTD, the document is said to be:
	
type-valid. .................ANS
	
not-type-valid. 
	
an HTML document. 
	
type-invalid. 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The DTD begins with the word:
	
HTTPS. 
	
XML. 
	
#PCDATA. 
	
DOCTYPE. .................ANS
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What is not true about XML?
	
Web page display is the most important application of XML.----------------ANS
	
XML documents have two sections. 
	
XML is more powerful than HTML. 
	
With XML, there is a clear separation between document structure, content and materialization. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
With XML: 
	
views are not limited to one multi-valued path only 
	
database data can automatically be extracted from XML documents only. 
	
All the given options ..................ANS
	
documents can automatically be generated from database data only. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


An XML component that defines the structure of a document is known as a(n):
	
DTD. ...............ANS
	
#PCDATA. 
	
HTML Stylesheet. 
	
DOCTYPE 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
XML is: 
	
a hybrid of document processing and database processing only. 
	
a standardized yet customizable way to describe the content of documents only. 
	
a subset of SGML only. 
	
All the given options ...............ANS
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
Which of the following statements is not true about XML Schemas:
	
They define a set of symbols and the relationships of those symbols. 
	
They are used to define the content and structure of data. 
	
They have their own syntax. .........................ANS
	
They are themselves XML documents. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
What is not true about SOAP?
	


SOAP was defined as an XML-based standard for providing remote procedure calls over the Internet. 
	
SOAP originally meant Simple Object Access Protocol. 
	
SOAP now is just a name, not an acronym 
	
SOAP was an early form of XML. .......................................ANS
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
XML Schemas consist of:
	
structure and data. 
	
tables and relationships. 
	
elements and attributes. .....................................ANS
	
properties and methods
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
hat is not true about XSLT?
	
XSLT uses a set of procedures that specify how a document is to be programmed. ..........................ANS
	
XSLT is a declarative transformation language. 
	
XSLT is used to transform the input document into another document. 
	
XSLT uses a set of rules that govern how a document is to be materialized is created. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
The document that is used by XSLT to indicate how to transform the elements of the XML document to another format is a(n):
	
DOCTYPE procedure. 
	
HTML page. 
	
stylesheet. .............................ANS
	
stored procedure. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
The expression FOR XML RAW tells SQL Server to:
	
place the values of the columns into elements rather than attributes. 
	
place some columns into elements and others into attributes. 
	
place the values of the columns as attributes in the resulting XML document. .......................ANS
	
None 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

They have their own syntax. ...............ANS
	
They define a set of symbols and the relationships of those symbols. 
	
They are used to define the content and structure of data. 
	
They are themselves XML documents.

a normalized definition table. 
	
None 
\------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 

What is not true about SOAP?
	
SOAP was defined as an XML-based standard for providing remote procedure calls over the Internet. 
	
SOAP was an early form of XML. ,......................ANS
	
SOAP now is just a name, not an acronym 
	
SOAP originally meant Simple Object Access Protocol. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
What is not true about SOAP?
	
SOAP originally meant Simple Object Access Protocol. 
	
SOAP now is just a name, not an acronym 
	
SOAP was defined as an XML-based standard for providing remote procedure calls over the Internet. 
	
SOAP was an early form of XML. .................ANS
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
The expression FOR XML RAW tells SQL Server to:
	
None 
	
place the values of the columns into elements rather than attributes. 
	
place the values of the columns as attributes in the resulting XML document...................ANS
	
place some columns into elements and others into attributes. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
What is not true about XSLT?
	
XSLT uses a set of rules that govern how a document is to be materialized is created. 
	
XSLT is used to transform the input document into another document. 
	
XSLT is a declarative transformation language. 
	
XSLT uses a set of procedures that specify how a document is to be programmed. .................ANS

They are used to define the content and structure of data. 
	
They are themselves XML documents. 
	
They have their own syntax. 
	
They define a set of symbols and the relationships of those symbols.

1>What will be size of object created depicted by csharp code snippet?

 class baseclass
 {
 private int a;
 protected int b;
 public int c;
 }
 class derived : baseclass
 {
 private int x;
 protected int y;
 public int z;
 }
 class Program
 {
 static Void Main(string[] args)
 {
 derived a = new derived();
 }
 } 
	
a)20 bytes 
	
b)16 bytes 
	
c)12 bytes 
	
d)24 bytes------------------------ANS

2>What will be the output of given code snippet?

 class access
 {
     public int x;
     private int y;
     public  void cal(int a, int b)
     {
         x = a + 1;
         y = b;
     }
 }    
 class Program
 {
     static void Main(string[] args)
     {
         access obj = new access();   
         obj.cal(2, 3);
         Console.WriteLine(obj.x + " " + obj.y);     
     }
 }
	
a)2 3 
	
b)Compile time error ------------------------ANS
	
c)Run time error 
	
d)3 3

3.What will be the output of given code snippet?

class access
{
    public int x;
    private int y;
    public  void cal(int a, int b)
    {
        x = a + 1;
        y = b;
    }
    public  void print() 
   {
       Console.WriteLine(" " + y);     
   } 
}    
class Program
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        access obj = new access();   
        obj.cal(2, 3);
        Console.WriteLine(obj.x);
        obj.print();
        Console.ReadLine();
    }
}
	
a)3 3 ------------------------ANS
	
b)Compile time error 
	
c)2 3 
	
d)Run time error 


============================================================================================================



4...What will be the output of following set of code?

 class sum   
 {
     public int x;
     public int y;
     public  int add (int a, int b)
    {
        x = a + b;
        y = x + b;
        return 0;
    }
}    
class Program
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        sum obj1 = new sum();
        sum obj2 = new sum();   
        int a = 2;
        obj1.add(a, a + 1);
        obj2.add(5, a);
        Console.WriteLine(obj1.x + "  " + obj2.y);     
        Console.ReadLine();
    }
}
	
a)6, 9 
	
b)3, 2 
	
c)9, 10 
	
d)5, 9 ------------------------ANS



============================================================================================================


5...What will be the output of following set of code?

class static_out
{
    public static int x;
    public  static int y;
    public int add(int a, int b)
    {
        x = a + b;
        y = x + b;
        return 0;
    }
}    
class Program
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        static_out obj1 = new static_out();
        static_out obj2 = new static_out();   
        int a = 2;
        obj1.add(a, a + 1);
        obj2.add(5, a);
        Console.WriteLine(static_out.x + " " + static_out.y );     
        Console.ReadLine();
    }
}
	
a)9 7 
	
b)6 6 
	
c)7 7 
	
d)7 9 ------------------------ANS


============================================================================================================

 {
     public int x;
     private int y;
     public void math(int a, int b)
     {
         x = a * 4;
         y = b;
     }
 }    
 class Program
 {
     static void Main(string[] args)
     {
         sum p = new sum();   
         p.math(12, 30);
         Console.WriteLine(p.x + "  " + p.y);
         Console.ReadLine();
     }
 }

7....What will be the output of code?

 class math
 {
     public int a,b;
     public math(int i,  int j)
     {
         a = i;
         b = j;
     }
     public  void sum(math m)
     {
         m.a *= 2;
         m.b += 2;
     }
 }    
 class Program
 {
     static void Main(string[] args)
     {
         math t = new math(20,  10);
         t.sum(t);
         Console.WriteLine(t.a + "  " + t.b);   
         Console.ReadLine();
     }
 }
	
a)20, 10 
	
b)40, 12 ------------------------ANS
	
c)10, 20 
	
d)5, 40

9....class test
 {
     public   int a;
     public  int b;
     public  test(int i, int j)
     {
         a = i;
         b = j;
     }
     public void meth(test o)
     {
         o.a *= 2;
         o.b /= 2;
     }
 }    
 class Program
 {
     static void Main(string[] args)
     {
         test obj = new test(10, 20);
         obj.meth(obj);
         Console.WriteLine(obj.a + " " + obj.b);    
         Console.ReadLine();
     }
 }
	
a)10, 20 
	
b)40, 20 
	
c)20, 40 
	
d)20, 10 ------------------------ANS

1-What will be the output of given code snippet?

public class Generic<T>
{
 Stack<T> stk = new Stack<T>();
 public void push(T obj)
 {
 stk.Push(obj);
 }
 public T pop()
 {
 T obj = stk.Pop();
 return obj;
 }
}
class Program
{
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 Generic<string> g = new Generic<string>();
 g.push("40");
 Console.WriteLine(g.pop());
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
} 
 
40 --------ANS
 
Compile time Error 
 
Runtime Error 
 
0

    }
}

    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        Generic<int>g = new Generic<int>();
        g.testSub();
    }
}

3--What will be the output of given code snippet?

public class Generic<T>
{
    Stack<T> stk = new Stack<T>();
    public void push(T obj)
    {
        stk.Push(obj);
    }
    public T pop()
    {
        T obj = stk.Pop();
        return obj;
    }
}
class Program
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        Generic<int> g = new Generic<int>();
        g.push("Csharp");
        Console.WriteLine(g.pop());
        Console.ReadLine();
    }
}

 
Compile time error 
 
Run time error 
 
0 
 
Csharp -----ANS

5-What will be the output for given set of code?

 namespace ConsoleApplication4
 {
     public abstract class A
     {
         public int i = 7;
         public abstract void display();
     }    
     class B: A 
     {
         public int j;
         public override void display() 
         {
             Console.WriteLine(i);
             Console.WriteLine(j);
         }
     }    
     class Program
     {
         static void Main(string[] args)
         {
             B obj = new B();
             A obj1 = new B();
             obj.j = 1;
             obj1.i = 8;
             obj.display();
             Console.ReadLine();
         }
     }
 }

 
1, 8 
 
0, 8 
 
7, 1 -----ANS
 
1, 7

13-What will be the output for given set of code?

 Namespace ConsoleApplication4
 {
 abstract class A
 {
 public int I ;
 public int j ;
 public abstract void display();
 } 
 class B: A 
 {
 public int j = 5;
 public override void display() 
 {
 this.j = 3;
 Console.WriteLine(I + “ “ + j);
 }
 } 
 class Program
 {
 static void Main(string[] args)
 {
 B obj = new B();
 obj.i = 1;
 obj.display(); 
 Console.ReadLine();
 }
 }
 } 
 
0 5 
 
1 5 
 
1 0 
 
1 3 -----ANS

18-What will be the output for given set of code?

Namespace ConsoleApplication4
{   
    abstract class A 
    {
        public int I;
        public abstract void display();
    }    
    class B: A 
    {
        public  int j;
        public int sum;
        public override void display() 
        {
            sum = I + j;
            Console.WriteLine(+I + “\n” + +j);
            Console.WriteLine(“sum is:” +sum);
        }
    }    
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            A obj = new B();
            obj.i = 2;
            B obj1 = new B();
            obj1.j = 10;
            obj.display();
            Console.ReadLine();
        }
    }
}

 
2, 0--------ANS
2 
 
0, 0
0 
 
0, 10
10 
 
2, 10
12

 x = 6;
 x = x * x;
 }
 }

 c++;

 {
     int i;
     i = 0;
     while (i++ < 5)
     {
         Console.WriteLine(i);
     }
     Console.WriteLine("\n");
     i = 0;
     while ( ++i < 5)
    {
        Console.WriteLine(i);
    }
    Console.ReadLine();
}

     {

         result = fact(n - 1) * n;
         return result;
     }

20-What is Recursion in CSharp defined as?

 
Recursion another process of defining a method that calls other methods repeatedly 
 
Recursion another form of class 
 
Recursion is a process of defining a method that calls itself repeatedly -------ANS
 
Recursion is a process of defining a method that calls other methods which in turn call again this method 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

21-Select the correct match of parameter declaration:

 static void main(string[] args)
 {
 int a = 5;
 int b = 6;
 float c = 7.2f;
 math (ref a, ref b, ref c);
 Console.WriteLine(a + " " + b + " " + c);
 }
 static int math(/*add parameter decelaration */)
 {
 a += b;
 b *= (int)c;
 c += a * b;
 return 0;
 } 
 
ref int a, ref int b, ref float c 
 
ref int a, ref int b, float c 
 
ref int a, ref float c, ref int b 
 
ref int a, int b, ref float c 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

22-Select output for following set of code :

static void Main(string[] args)
{
    int x;
    for (x = 10; x <= 15; x++)
    while (Convert.ToBoolean(Convert.ToInt32(x)))
    {
        do
        {
            Console.WriteLine(1);
            if (Convert.ToBoolean(x >> 1))
            continue;
        }while (Convert.ToBoolean(0));
        break;
    }
    Console.ReadLine();
}

 
System outofflow exception error. 
 
1 1 1….infinite times 
 
0 0 0….infinite times 
 
1 1 1 1 1 1 -------ANS

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
